On Jun 23, 2007, at 2:48 AM, Mike Dierken wrote:

> A full update via PUT has the possibility of being cached without  
> requiring the new version of the resource to be sent in the  
> response, whereas a partial update via PUT does not allow this  
> possibility.


Everybody seems to consider the logging of a GET request as something  
that a server can do without violating the "SAFE" constraint. It  
seems to me that the right way to handle PUT is similar - a PUT  
should be a "logical" replace, but I can't see anything wrong with  
the server adding a link to the representation, for example to point  
to some resource updated as a side-effect. Caching the representation  
that is being PUT would make this impossible.

Stefan
--
Stefan Tilkov, http://www.innoq.com/blog/st/
